data.title: At the building stage, Running "download-atom-shell" task ends without errors
data.body:
Atom: v1.0.2
Node: v0.12.6
npm: v2.5.1
Archlinux (4.0.7-2-ARCH, x86_64)

At the building stage (script/build), the script ends at the following task without dumping any errors:

`Running "download-atom-shell" task`

If you are facing on the same issue, it is probably due to a bug with the request module failing with users behind proxy (https://github.com/atom/node-github-releases/issues/2).

You can add the `--stack` option to the file `script/utils/run-grunt.js` to dump the hidden error to your console (@ the line 14):

`var args = ['--gruntfile', path.resolve('build', 'Gruntfile.coffee'), '--stack'];`

Then rebuild Atom thanks to the same command line `./script/build` will probably dump a similar error:

```
TypeError: Request path contains unescaped characters.
…
```

I temporary fixed the issue by removing my *_proxy env variables (bash):

`unset http_proxy https_proxy ftp_proxy HTTP_PROXY HTTPS_PROXY FTP_PROXY no_proxy NO_PROXY`

and then everything goes well:

```
Running "download-atom-shell" task
Running "download-atom-shell-chromedriver" task
Running "build" task
Running "coffee:glob_to_multiple" (coffee) task
>> 333 files created.
Running "prebuild-less:src" (prebuild-less) task
Running "cson:glob_to_multiple" (cson) task
>> 170 files compiled to JSON.
Running "peg:glob_to_multiple" (peg) task
Running "generate-license:save" (generate-license) task
Running "generate-module-cache" task
Running "compile-packages-slug" task
Running "set-version" task
Running "generate-asar" task
Done, without errors.
```

It will be preferable to definitely fix the issue by replacing the version of the `tunnel-agent` package (https://github.com/npm/npm/issues/4569#issuecomment-62051308).

Thanks.

data.title: Links within Package/Theme Notes do nothing
data.body:
First, Atom is awesome. Plain and simple. Just awesome.

I'm on Ubuntu 14.04 running Atom 1.0.2

The only issue I have, and it's small, is that when I click on links on the theme/package detail pages, nothing happens. While looking at a package, for example, if I click 'View on Atom.io', nothing happens; if I click the github url above, nothing happens; if I see a link within the description and click that, nothing happens; etc.. Basically, anytime a link should open up in Chrome, it doesn't.

data.title: Website 500 error when searching
data.body:
Hi Guys,

Are you already aware that your search function on the atom.io website is down. Every time I search for something on the documentation site it gives a 500 error. I also can't search for packages within Atom, which reading your past issues could be related?

data.title: Keep files open after close and start
data.body:
Hey,

it would be nice if atom would open the files  when I start atom again.

If I currently have 3 files open and close atom upon restarting atom only the first file is still open in editor.

data.title: Use `border-box` to prevent losing subpixel AA
OSX: ctrl-backspace binding not working
data.body:
I have the following binding:

``` cson
'ctrl-backspace'  : 'editor:delete-to-beginning-of-word'
```

It's being blatantly ignored :(

OSX 10.10.4
Atom 1.0.2

data.title: Node modules removed although later needed and abort no warning
data.body:
In branch `v1.0.2`, I build atom and facing below error.
### Machine

``` sh
$ uname -a
Linux machname 4.0.6-1-ARCH #1 SMP PREEMPT Tue Jun 23 14:25:08 CEST 2015 x86_64 GNU/Linux
```

an Arch-linux.
### Errors
#### Necessary Module Removed

Snip it, so there something like this:

``` sh
Installing apm...
# ...
Removing cache-swap ✓
Removing csslint ✓
Removing grunt-lib-contrib ✓
```

three module removed. Then,

``` sh
Deduping modules ✓
Loading "less-lint-task.js" tasks...ERROR
>> Error: Cannot find module 'csslint'
Loading "lint-cache.js" tasks...ERROR
>> Error: Cannot find module 'cache-swap'
Loading "less.js" tasks...ERROR
>> Error: Cannot find module 'grunt-lib-contrib'
```

I got error on exactly about missing those packages. This can be prevented, however, by manually copying those package to `node_modules` folder on running build.
#### Abort Due to Invisible Warning

If I doing that, the build process happy till the end where all the time, it keeps saying,

``` sh
Aborted due to warnings.
```
### Note

I modify the script to increase verbosity,
- Put `--no-quiete --stack` options inside `script/build`
- Adding `--loginfo verbose` to each command variable in `script/bootstrap`
  So, if you see the log, it pretty verbose.

I once see this kind of issue but on Windows. 
I can't remember the title and in-search of it.
Thanks
### Attachment
#### Module Removed

``` sh
$ script/build
Node: v0.12.5
npm: v2.5.1
Installing build modules...
# more here, see below
Installing apm...
# more here, see below
Removing cache-swap ✓
Removing csslint ✓
Removing grunt-lib-contrib ✓
Installing modules ✓
Deduping modules ✓
Loading "less-lint-task.js" tasks...ERROR
>> Error: Cannot find module 'csslint'
Loading "lint-cache.js" tasks...ERROR
>> Error: Cannot find module 'cache-swap'
Loading "less.js" tasks...ERROR
>> Error: Cannot find module 'grunt-lib-contrib'

Running "download-atom-shell" task

Running "download-atom-shell-chromedriver" task

Running "build" task

Running "coffee:glob_to_multiple" (coffee) task
>> 335 files created.

Running "prebuild-less:src" (prebuild-less) task

Running "cson:glob_to_multiple" (cson) task
>> 170 files compiled to JSON.

Running "peg:glob_to_multiple" (peg) task

Running "generate-license:save" (generate-license) task
Aborted due to warnings.
```
#### Abort No Warning

``` sh
$ script/build
Node: v0.12.5
npm: v2.5.1
```

data.title: Add a status when Atom is downloading a new update
data.body:
When I know there is a new update available for Atom, I can run "Check for Update" in the Help menu. Sometimes it is already running. The problem is lack of feedback: it seems, if it found an update, and is now downloading one, it doesn't tell the user it is doing this. Which would be useful.

Instead, as it is downloading the update, it simply looks like it is stuck checking for one. It would be nice if the Menu item could change to something like "Downloading Update (1.0.2) 43%..." or similar while it is doing this, to give feedback to the user that something is actually going on.

data.title: Atom freezing when opening minified JS files with all content on one line
data.body:
I have some minified JS files which are ~250kb in size, but all the code is concatenated onto one line. Opening files like this freezes up Atom and triggers the "Editor is not responding" window.

It's interesting, because I read in another issue that Atom had no problem opening files with millions of lines and tens of megabytes.

Is there something about all the content being on one line that makes performance suffer?

The google chrome developer console doesn't seem to have any issues displaying or even prettifying the minified JS files.

data.title: Incorrect Symbol Pairing
data.body:
Running Atom v1.0.2 on Yosemite
![screen shot 2015-07-22 at 8 58 25 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4573033/8840894/58bd4172-30b5-11e5-94db-c4ed7cc788f9.png)
https://cloudup.com/cDuqPmzypsC

Confirmed incorrect pairing for both brackets and parenthesis.

data.title: Linux DPI scaling is not working
data.body:
Atom version is 1.0.2, running on elementary Freya, based on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS. Kernel is 3.19.0. 

Screenshots demonstrating the problem:

![](https://i.imgur.com/rPAKCR0.png)

![](https://i.imgur.com/kwbZ4dZ.png)

Windows on the left scale properly on a HiDPI display (MacBook 13" 2013 edition in this case, native resolution is 2560x1600px), next to Atom, which isn't scaling.

data.title: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'cursor' of undefined
data.body:
This problem starts to repro on/after https://github.com/atom/atom/commit/5a799578dea41f389e3a23bb7edfd8284aabf303.

This error appears in the console when you try to open the fuzzy finder (cmd+t) -- which is unsuccessful. I'm also unable to open any files via clicking on them in the file tree, though this doesn't result in an error in the console.

Trace:

![screenshot 2015-07-22 14 48 31](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1017111/8838366/f73bf9e0-3080-11e5-9283-06980f4e7ccd.png)

data.title: config.cson opens on startup
data.body: Every time.. I remove config as a project folder and it reopens and config.cson opens up.

data.title: OSX 10.9.5, Atom 1.0.2: Saving file in atom gives random number of changes in git diff
data.body:
Hello,
I downloaded today the latest version of Atom, and find that even when I change one line of a file of my repo in GitHub, I get a large amount of changes through git diff (452 in the Screen Shot_change saved below).
![screen shot_change without saving](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7450069/8834305/5ff8fbae-3081-11e5-9e80-3febb07d63a6.png)
![screen shot_change saved](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7450069/8834322/79cac972-3081-11e5-94d2-2a6ef1fa1138.png)
I tried changing the standard editor from Vim to atom, at no avail. This doesn't seem to be the issue seen previously on Windows, regarding the last line added by atom, as the changes appear randomly. I started atom in safe mode but still see the problem. I don't have the problem when I make a small change using other editors (Vim).
I'm new with git and atom so it might be some configuration problem?
Thank you in advance for your time,
Marcos

data.title: Can't write @ character
data.body: I have Windows 8. I was trying to write a single @ character using the ALT GR - Q keys. At beginning I though was a problem of my keyboard configuration, so I tried by using the onscreen keyboard tactile, and typing the @ character directly, but it doesn't render it anyway.

data.title: open new file in an already open window
data.body:
I'm using atom 1.0.0 in Ubuntu. 
When i run `atom nonExistantFile`, a **new window** is opened for it.
As atom is slow on start-up, that's very inconvenient. Is there an option to open in an already open window?

data.title: HTML commenting for a `<script>` tag does `//` comment first
data.body:
When trying to comment out a `<script>` tag it adds the `//` JavaScript style comments first and then if you hit `Ctrl + /` then it will do HTML style comments. All other standard HTML tags will be commented out right, it's just `script` tags that are not being commented on the first hit.

Why does this happen? Shouldn't it just do standard HTML style commenting on script tags?

data.title: Open dialog box does not dismiss or open selected item
data.body: The Open file/folder dialog box allows me to navigate to a file or folder, but both the Open and Cancel buttons don't do anything. The dialog remains on screen. I can click through to the editor window, but the dialog does not disappear. The only way to get the dialog to disappear is by force-quitting Atom. https://www.dropbox.com/s/rbpigysa2h5k6b1/2015-07-22%2011.53.04.mov?dl=0 I am able to open files and folders by dragging them to the Dock icon.

data.title: When looking for '/' charcter with Command-F, Atom editor freezing.
data.body:
When I looked for "/" charcter, Atom Editor freezing.

Atom 1.0.2
OS X 10.10.4

data.title: Atom does not render underscore characters (_) every few lines
data.body:
This is Atom 1.0.2 on Linux.

I am not seeing Underscore characters rendered every few lines, which is making the editor dangerous to work with in programming, as I cannot determine the difference between `foo_bar` and `foo bar`.
![underscore_missing](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/65913/8825843/44fd6280-3082-11e5-857d-4897af03030c.png)

This screen shot is taken with Font size 15. The line height is set to 1.1. This happens every 12 lines, but not reliably.

It does not happen with font size 14, but also happens with 16 and above. See this video that shows the effect:
![atom_underscore](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/65913/8825897/9b2e950c-3082-11e5-8121-8234ff39f361.gif)

data.title: Copy selection command to only write to clipboard if text selected
data.body:
Closes https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/7103

Add a new command, `editor:copy-selection`, that writes to the clipboard only if the user has selected text

data.title: Uncaught Error: Encountered an invalid scope end id. Popped -59, expected to pop -63.
data.body:
[Enter steps to reproduce below:]
1. ...
2. ...

**Atom Version**: 1.0.2
**System**: Mac OS X 10.10.4
**Thrown From**: Atom Core
### Stack Trace

Uncaught Error: Encountered an invalid scope end id. Popped -59, expected to pop -63.

```
At /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/tokenized-buffer.js:629

Error: Encountered an invalid scope end id. Popped -59, expected to pop -63.
  at TokenizedBuffer.module.exports.TokenizedBuffer.scopesFromTags (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/tokenized-buffer.js:619:23)
  at TokenizedBuffer.module.exports.TokenizedBuffer.openScopesForRow (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/tokenized-buffer.js:601:21)
  at TokenizedBuffer.module.exports.TokenizedBuffer.tokenizeNextChunk (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/tokenized-buffer.js:294:105)
  at /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/tokenized-buffer.js:271:26
  at /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/underscore-plus/node_modules/underscore/underscore.js:666:47

```

data.title: editor:cut-to-end-of-line on empty line above fold deletes the whole fold
data.body:
I feel there are a couple of inconsistencies with code folding. At least I can prove this one:

`editor:cut-to-end-of-line` is by default bound to `ctrl-k` on darwin, so I use it a lot for deleting current line.

The default behavoiur when cursor is on an _empty_ line is to delete the current line (delete the newline).

But if the line below is folded, that one is deleted as well (and not even cut. It's deleted). I've tried to make a demonstration in this gif. It first demonstrates normal behaviour, and then what happens when the line below is folded.

![Demo](http://zippy.gfycat.com/ShortWeightyHorseshoebat.gif)

data.title: Atom does not show installed community packages after update to v1.0.2
data.body:
Hi all,

I got a problem with displaying the installed community packages in my atom installation.
Before the upgrade to 1.0.2 (and much package upgrades...) I was able to see all installed packages in the atom gui. After the last upgrade, I only see 3 of them (see attached screenshot). This issue seems to have nothing to do with a skin (I resetted id and the problem persisted) or plugin (tested it without plugins, too), all plugins seem to run fine. If I search them in Settings -> Install I am able to configure their settings, too. Local apm does also list all installed plugins correctly, updates are retrieveable.

On the other side, I get a full listing of all installed Core Packages

Would be thankful for your suggestions.

![screen1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/757613/8818927/31e93df8-3047-11e5-851f-313015981604.jpg)

data.title: Editor image preview does not load with % in its URI
data.body:
Let me begin by thanking you for the great editor! It's much better than any alternatives I've found.
I am using Atom 1.0.2 and Windows 8.1 x64.
When opening an image with `%` in its URI, it is not displayed properly, but can still be opened from the tree view. The dev tools report an `ERR_FILE_NOT_FOUND`.
![image](http://i.imgur.com/a4FM6tK.png)

Removing the `%`s seem to fix this issue.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6508913/8817512/ab35bc3a-3066-11e5-87ad-1882c130ecf2.png)

data.title: editor folding keybinding & international keyboards
data.body:
On some keyboard locale, one need to use `ctrl-alt` to access bracket & braces.

This mean I cannot type `[` without also typing `ctrl-alt-[`
The following key binding suppress character entry to do some editor-folding action.

```
"ctrl-alt-[": "editor:fold-current-row",
"ctrl-alt-]": "editor:unfold-current-row",
"ctrl-alt-{": "editor:fold-all",
"ctrl-alt-}": "editor:unfold-all",
```

It may be a small user base, but not being able to type `[]{}` in a programing editor is a big usability problem !

data.title: Tree-view doesn't show some folders without any consistency.
data.body:
Hi all,

Before I begin, thank you for the great text editor :)

I'm using Mac OS 10.10.4 and Atom 1.0.2.
In one Django project, I have a path like ..../project/static/lib/bootstrap.....
Atom wouldn't show the lib folder at all. I checked the Atom setting whether I accidentally included that folder but I didn't.
I opened another Django project which also has lib folder. Atom shows that folder in this case.
![screen shot 2015-07-22 at 10 08 44 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5738363/8815852/0be7088e-305a-11e5-8e11-467aee9e2990.png)

I thought it was weird but I decided to move on until I found another behavior.
I created /static/icon/ and it didn't show that folder either. 
![screen shot 2015-07-22 at 10 08 04 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5738363/8815853/0be763f6-305a-11e5-918a-eaadb2a69f78.png)

Then I changed the folder name to 'icons' then it showed!!! I changed '/lib/' to '/libs/' then it also showed. I experimented with '/images/' but that folder always appeared in any case.

![screen shot 2015-07-22 at 10 08 26 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5738363/8815854/0be7bbbc-305a-11e5-9bd5-45a15a45ac4e.png)

I think this is not an intended behavior. Any ideas?
